identity.short_description: A 12th century castle classified as a Monument Historique, set within a 15-hectare park near Montpellier. A 4-star hotel with 24 rooms sleeping 55 guests, offering exclusive privatisation for weddings of up to 200 seated guests.

location.landscape_description: Between the Mediterranean and the Cevennes, in the heart of unspoilt countryside in the Gard department

history.historical_narrative: The existence of Chateau de Pondres is attested in 1195 in the testament of the Seigneur d'Anduze. The chateau was the property of the great families of Anduze and Ganges. Its current architecture derives from a major campaign of works carried out in the mid-17th century by Pierre II de Crouzet. Like many monuments in the Gard, it was looted and set ablaze during the French Revolution. The Marquis de Montlaur was forced to flee. Joseph Isidor de Montlaur returned at the beginning of the 19th century. Raymond Archambaud de Montlaur carried out the complete reconstruction of the south wing. Acquired in 1920 by an agricultural engineer, the chateau fell into disuse throughout the 20th century. It became the property of the Conseil General du Gard in 2004 and was ceded in 2006 to the current owner for an immense campaign of works under the aegis of the Conservation des Monuments Historiques, which lasted 10 years.

spaces.name: Cour d'Honneur
notable_features: breathtaking view of basin, fountains, and French gardens
connects to Salle des Repas, Salons du Temps, and Chapel
spaces.description: A majestic space of 500 m2, the Cour d'Honneur overlooks the chateau's park and offers a breathtaking view of the basin, fountains, and French gardens. In fine weather, it lends itself to outdoor receptions, weddings, christenings, and family gatherings.

spaces.name: Salle des Repas
notable_features: three large openings with natural light
spaces.description: A former armoury (Salle d'Armes), this beautiful vaulted room of 93 m2 opens onto the Cour d'Honneur. Bathed in natural light through three large openings. During weddings it serves as breakfast room, dance floor and bar, and backup venue for secular ceremonies in case of rain. Can also serve as a children's room.

spaces.name: La Chapelle
notable_features: canvas paintings with Angels of the Annunciation
spaces.description: Features canvas paintings with deep symbolism carried by the Angels of the Annunciation. Coats of arms recalling the nobility of the estate's owners. Fully restored altar. Simple and intimate ceremonies can take place in the chateau's chapel.

spaces.name: Salle des Etats Generaux
spaces.description: Adorned with a magnificent sculpted stone fireplace and French painted ceilings, the Salle des Etats Generaux is a prestigious room rich in the chateau's history. At dusk, sunsets over the Pic Saint-Loup bathe the room in golden light. Together with the adjacent Salle des Arts, it hosts banquets and grand events during cold or wet seasons.

spaces.name: Salle des Arts
notable_features: adjacent to Salle des Etats Generaux
spaces.description: Adjacent to the Salle des Etats Generaux, together they host banquets and grand events during cold or wet seasons - an excellent fallback for weddings on rainy days.

spaces.name: Salle de Musique
spaces.description: Essential witness to a storied past, the Music Room is arranged in the south wing of the chateau. A confidential and convivial space, it hosts wine receptions (vin d'honneur), end-of-evening gatherings, bridal preparations, or children's areas.

spaces.name: Salon de Reception
spaces.description: The Reception Lounge is arranged in a row with the Music Room and Library in the south wing. A confidential and convivial space for wine receptions, end-of-evening gatherings, bridal preparations, or children's areas.

spaces.name: Bibliotheque
spaces.description: A period Library arranged in the south wing of the chateau alongside the Music Room and Reception Lounge. A confidential and convivial space for wine receptions, end-of-evening gatherings, bridal preparations, or children's areas.

spaces.name: Parc et Jardins
spaces.description: Built on terraces with benches and vine-covered shade structures near fountains and water features, the landscaped gardens accommodate large receptions, country banquets, or wine receptions. The chateau's park, bordered by a river with fully restored period pathways, offers beautiful walks in the shade of century-old trees - perfect for wedding photos.

buildings.name: Le Chateau
buildings.description: 12 rooms on the second floor of the chateau.

buildings.name: La Maison des Bois
buildings.description: 4 rooms in the Maison des Bois (The Woodland House).

catering.cuisine_style: Refined traditional cuisine based on short supply circuits and the best local Mediterranean produce
catering.brunch_description: A sumptuous brunch on Sunday to round off the stay.

ceremony.chapel_details: Restored chapel with canvas paintings featuring the Angels of the Annunciation, coats of arms, and fully restored altar. Simple and intimate ceremonies can take place here.
ceremony.rain_backup_plan: Salle des Repas serves as backup venue for secular ceremonies in case of rain. Salle des Etats Generaux and Salle des Arts serve as fallback for banquets and events during cold or wet seasons.

amenities.gardens_description: 15-hectare park several centuries old, bordered by the river Aygalade, with French gardens, fountains, water features, terraces, benches, vine-covered shade structures, and restored period pathways in the shade of century-old trees.

accessibility.accessibility_details: Full PMR (disabled) accessibility throughout the chateau. Elevator/lift available. Independent disabled (PMR) parking.
